There are about 700,000 people in the city. It merged into one from four smaller towns.
Visitors reach Sagamihara on the JR Yokohama Line at Kobuchi, Fuchinobe, Yabe, or Sagamihara stations.

value: content=Contains an indoor pool called the Ginga Arena. The pool is divided into a shallow area and a deeper area. In wintertime the pool becomes a skating rink. The park is also home to the Sagamihara Stadium, in which pro baseball and high school basketball games are played.
content= 11 minute walk from the station.
means "place where many works of art are kept". This is the only art museum in Sagamihara.

content=Contains a duck pond also frequented by swans. The park also contains a mock road where children can learn the rules of the road while riding their bicycles or go-carts. The park is a popular spot for picnicking during the cherry blossom season in early April; flower aficionados will also enjoy the park's hydrangea bushes during the rainy season.
content= 11 minute walk from the station. This temple was built in 1598.
content=A popular spot to see summer fireworks.
content= Displays flowers during all four seasons.

content=Sagamihara River is clean and safe enough to play in, and is a popular spot for riverside barbecuing. Some local events are held there, such as the carp-shaped streamer/flag/windsock festival in May. These fish-shaped windsocks are made from cloth. At the height of the festival, and estimated 1,200 carp windsocks swim in the sky above Sagamihara.

content=Dates back  20,000 years. These are the oldest ruins in Japan. There is an historical museum nearby where you can learn about the area's history and culture. An old residence has been restored in the outdoor exhibition.

content= Contains a large lake in which fishing is permitted. There are flower markets, an observatory, and a mountain named Shiroyama. Mount Shiroyama is easily climbed because it's only 375 meters high. In early April, this is a popular spot for cherry blossom festivals and picnics.
content=You can play darts and karaoke here. If you don't want to move to there from another place, you can have a party also. You can have dinner there.
content=This is karaoke place. It is a 3 minute walk from the station.

content=The ground floor has food shops, game shops, and a food court. IWorld also has pachinko (a type of mechanical gambling machine). The first floor is the "fashion floor" where watches, clothes, and jewelry are sold. There is also a recycle shop (thrift store). There is an Internet cafe on the second floor.
directions=5 minute walk from the station
directions=3 minutes from Hashimoto Station's south exit

content=These are two shops combined. Prier is a cake shop; Cafe Corretto is a cafe. They have a take-away cake service. At night, the shops' lighting is considerably reduced, so the shops have distinctly different atmospheres at suppertime compared to daytime.
directions=5 minutes from Sagamihara Station's south exit
content=Known for its cheese fondue, this restaurant stocks 20 kinds of imported beer and has a big screen for watching sports.
content=Contains a large aquarium done up in blue and black. This dining bar has a good selection of wines.
content=Bar attendant will show you the performance.
content=It takes 3 minutes walk from the station.
